intro: Achudemia japonica, commonly known as the Japanese evergreen hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Japan and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a glossy green surface, and its flowers range in color from white to pink or red. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens.
